clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment With Nivolumab at the Fixed Dose 40 mg (Nivo40) in Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Hodgkins Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Nivolumab at the Fixed Dose 40 mg (Nivo40) in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Hodgkins Lymphoma.

lead_sponsor.agency: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

clinical_study.source: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: A phase I/II trial to evaluate the safety and efficacy of nivolumab at the fixed dose 40 mg in patients with relapsed or refractory Hodgkins lymphoma.

primary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR), defined as the proportion of patients with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) in measurable lesions as defined by LYRIC criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of grade 3 or higher treatment-related adverse events by CTCAE 4.03
secondary_outcome.description: Toxicity parameters based on NCI CTCAE 4.03 grades: hematological toxicity (CBC), hepatotoxicity (liver function tests), nephrotoxicity (creatinine), neurotoxicity (attending physician assessment), fatigue (attending physician assessment), rash (attending physician assessment), colitis (attending physician assessment), pneumonitis (attending physician assessment), autoimmune disorders (level of hormones, presence of autoimmune antibodies, attending physician assessment).

arm_group.description: Experimental: Nivolumab Nivolumab 40 mg IV over 60 minutes on day 1. Treatment repeats every 14 days for up to 24 courses in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

intervention.description: 40 mg by intravenous (IV) infusion on day 1 Duration of cycle 14 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis: Histologically confirmed Hodgkins lymphoma
- Relapsed or refractory disease after at least two prior lines of treatment
- Age 18-70 years old
- Signed informed consent
- No severe concurrent illness
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled bacterial or fungal infection at the time of enrollment
- Requirement for vasopressor support at the time of enrollment
- Karnofsky index <30%
- Pregnancy
- Somatic or psychiatric disorder making the patient unable to sign informed consent
- Active or prior documented autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment.
